p: The effects of quinine in the human body is well studied as it has been in use for years, primarily for the treatment of malaria. It has been reported that quinine produces mild to severe side effects at therapeutic concentrations in malaria treatment [ 130]. Mild symptoms include headache, nausea, and tinnitus; while more severe side effects include vertigo, vomiting, loss of vision, and marked auditory loss [ 130]. Identifying quinine as an antiviral drug is a good starting point, but more evaluation and calibration to optimize the dose and duration of treatment to minimize prolonged exposure and its associated side effects must be performed before it can be prescribed to treat viral infections.
